attributes.description: Lists the playback and recording tape speeds (inches per second) that the reel-to-reel unit can operate at

attributes.name: Telephone cable interface
attributes.description: Defines the plug type used in telephone cables, such as RJ-10

attributes.name: Telephone cable second interface
attributes.description: Defines the connector type on the opposite end of the cable when it differs from the primary interface (e.g., RJ45 to RJ11)

attributes.name: Telephone cord style
attributes.description: Specifies the physical form of the telephone cord, aiding customers who need a straight, coiled or specialty cable for replacement handsets and wall-mounts.

attributes.name: Telephone style
attributes.description: Defines the design or aesthetic of a telephone, e.g. vintage, novelty

attributes.name: Television circuit board type
attributes.description: Identifies the functional role of the circuit board within a television set (e.g., main board, power supply board, T-Con board)

attributes.name: Television speaker position
attributes.description: Identifies the physical location or role of the speaker within the TV assembly (e.g., left, right, center, subwoofer)

attributes.name: Television specialized features
attributes.description: Identifies unique capabilities of a TV, like voice control or built-in soundbar

attributes.name: Tensioning system
attributes.description: Details the mechanism used to keep the screen surface flat and wrinkle-free

attributes.name: Termination method
attributes.description: Specifies the technique used to attach conductors to the connector contacts (e.g., crimp, solder, IDC)

attributes.name: Tethering policy
attributes.description: Clarifies whether mobile hotspot or tethering is allowed under the eSIM plan terms

attributes.name: Thumb grip profile
attributes.description: Describes the surface or shape style of the thumb grip's top (e.g., concave, domed), which affects grip and control feel

attributes.name: Tonearm type
attributes.description: Describes the geometry of the tonearm, which affects tracking performance and DJ usability

attributes.name: Top-up method
attributes.description: Specifies the ways customers can add additional credit or renew the plan on the prepaid card or SIM.

attributes.name: Touch capabilities
attributes.description: Indicates the type of touch interaction an electronic supports, such as single or dual

attributes.name: Touchpad form factor
attributes.description: Defines the intended installation or usage style of the touchpad

attributes.name: Touchscreen technology
attributes.description: Identifies the touchscreen technology for interactive devices, such as capacitive or resistive

attributes.name: Touchscreen wire configuration
attributes.description: Indicates the number of wires or lines used by resistive digitizers, affecting compatibility with controllers

attributes.name: Track configuration
attributes.description: Indicates the tape track format and channels the machine can record or play (e.g., stereo vs mono, number of tracks)

attributes.name: Tracker form factor
attributes.description: Defines the physical style and shape of the tracker hardware

attributes.name: Tracking purpose
attributes.description: Specifies the intended use of GPS tracking devices, such as asset tracking or pet tracking

attributes.name: Transceiver form factor
attributes.description: Defines the physical module standard of the networking transceiver (e.g., SFP, QSFP28)

attributes.name: Transmitter form factor
attributes.description: Classifies the physical style or housing of the transmitter unit to help shoppers quickly find the form that suits their application

attributes.name: Tuner type
attributes.description: Defines the type of radio frequency received, such as AM/FM or satellite radio

attributes.name: UC platform certification
attributes.description: Identifies unified-communications or meeting platforms for which the device is officially certified.

attributes.name: UPS topology
attributes.description: Indicates the internal design approach a UPS uses to condition and supply power (e.g., standby, line-interactive, online)

attributes.name: USB connector type
attributes.description: Identifies the physical USB connector(s) provided on the device for data and/or power.

attributes.name: USB standard
attributes.description: Specifies the USB version for electronic devices, such as USB 2.0 or USB 3.1 Gen 1

attributes.name: Uplink port type
attributes.description: Defines the highest-speed uplink connector present on the switch (e.g., SFP+, QSFP28, 10GBase-T)

attributes.name: VCR configuration
attributes.description: Identifies if the unit is a standalone VCR or a combo device with additional drives or tuners

attributes.name: VDI protocol support
attributes.description: Specifies the supported Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) protocols, e.g. PCoIP, RDP

attributes.name: VESA mounting pattern
attributes.description: Defines the VESA hole spacing on the back of the monitor for compatibility with mounts, arms, and stands

attributes.name: Vehicle mounting location
attributes.description: Specifies the area in a vehicle where the mount is intended to be installed

attributes.name: Ventilation type
attributes.description: Describes the primary vent style or airflow features of the enclosure that manage internal temperature

attributes.name: Video codecs/formats supported
attributes.description: Defines the video codecs and formats a device supports, such as MP4 or H.264

attributes.name: Video port type
attributes.description: Specifies the type of video port a product supports, e.g. HDMI, display port

attributes.name: Video recorder type
attributes.description: Specifies the fundamental recording technology of the device (e.g., DVR, NVR, XVR)

attributes.name: Video region code
attributes.description: Defines the region compatibility of DVD and Blu-ray players, such as region-free or region 1

attributes.name: Video signal standard
attributes.description: Specifies the analog video broadcast standard(s) supported by the device (e.g., NTSC, PAL, SECAM)

attributes.name: VoIP protocol support
attributes.description: Specifies the Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) protocols a device can support, such as SIP or IAX

attributes.name: Voice recorder form factor
attributes.description: Describes the physical style or disguise of the recorder so shoppers can pick the design that fits their use case

attributes.name: WAN interface type
attributes.description: Specifies the physical connection type used for the router's WAN/Internet uplink (e.g., Ethernet, fiber, DSL, cellular)

attributes.name: Weather alert technology
attributes.description: Specifies the alert standard or certification supported by the radio for automated emergency warnings

attributes.name: Wheel style
attributes.description: Describes the physical rim shape or driving discipline style

attributes.name: Wi-Fi band
attributes.description: Specifies the wireless frequency range of a device, such as 2.4 GHz

attributes.name: Wi-Fi standard
attributes.description: Specifies the wireless networking protocol, such as 802.11ac

attributes.name: Wireless charging standard
attributes.description: Identifies the inductive charging protocol(s) supported by the phone.

attributes.name: Wireless multi-room platform
attributes.description: Defines the proprietary or third-party ecosystem used for multi-room audio streaming

attributes.name: Wireless streaming protocols supported
attributes.description: Identifies the wireless streaming standards or services the stereo can receive natively

attributes.name: Wrist rest features
attributes.description: Lists special functional or design characteristics that add value

attributes.name: Wrist rest type
attributes.description: Identifies the intended device pairing or set configuration of the wrist rest (e.g., keyboard only, mouse only, combined sets)

attributes.name: XLR pin count
attributes.description: Indicates the specific pin configuration (number of pins) of the XLR connectors
